Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size compatibility with mesopores, combined with electrostatic attraction, metal coordination, and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH 8.5, concentrations 5-40 μg mL-1, MALDI-TOF MS analysis
Other Information.Additional Info: Selectively enriched by entrapment in mesopores in two or three dimensions.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size compatibility with mesopores, combined with electrostatic attraction, metal coordination, and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH 8.5, different concentrations, MALDI-TOF MS analysis
Other Information.Additional Info: Selectively enriched by entrapment in mesopores.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion and strong electrostatic repulsion (at pH 8.5); Passes due to reduced electrostatic repulsion and increased electrostatic attraction (at pH 5.5).

Other Information.Additional Info: Strong electrostatic repulsion prevented passage at pH 8.5. Enrichment was observed at pH 5.5.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to being too large for diffusion into mesopores.

Other Information.Additional Info: Low electrostatic repulsion, but size is the primary factor for exclusion.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Combination of size exclusion and electrostatic repulsion.

Other Information.Additional Info: Failure to enrich ascribed to combined factors of size and electrostatic repulsion.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Combination of size exclusion and electrostatic repulsion.

Other Information.Additional Info: Failure to enrich ascribed to combined factors of size and electrostatic repulsion.
Excluded from protein mixtures, enabling selective enrichment of target proteins.

Sieving Mechanism: Size-selective and electrostatic exclusion for proteins.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Limits of detection (LODs) were 5 μg mL-1 for Lyz and 20 μg mL-1 for RNA. Adsorption capacities: RNA 12.23 μmol g-1, Lyz 9.33 μmol g-1, Mb 0.17 μmol g-1, Pa 2.61 μmol g-1, HRP 0.11 μmol g-1, BHb 0.32 μmol g-1. Significant enhancement of MS signals and S/N ratios for target proteins (Lyz, RNA) in pure solutions, protein mixtures, and real biosamples (egg white, human serum).

Other Information.Additional Info: Magnetic MOF composite (Fe3O4 core with a ~20 nm MIL-100(Fe) shell) used for protein separation. Exhibits high magnetic responsivity, enabling facile separation. Reusable for multiple enrichment cycles. This method provides selective enrichment of target proteins and exclusion of undesired proteins/salts from complex biosamples, addressing challenges in MALDI-TOF MS analysis of low-abundance proteins.
